text: Eudonia critica is a moth in the family Crambidae. It was named by Edward Meyrick in 1884. It is endemic to New Zealand. The wingspan is 13–15.5 mm. The forewings are fuscous-grey, mixed with blackish. The median space is irrorated with white. The hindwings are dark fuscous-grey, becoming darker posteriorly. Adults have been recorded on wing in January. ==References== Category:Moths described in 1884 Category:Scopariinae Category:Endemic fauna of New Zealand Category:Moths of New Zealand Category:Taxa named by Edward Meyrick
title: Eudonia critica
